Victoria Claflin Woodhull, later Victoria Woodhull Martin (September 23, 1838  
June 9, 1927) was an American leader of the woman's suffrage movement. In 
1872, Woodhull ran for President of the United States. While many historians and 
authors agree that Woodhull was the first woman to run for President of the 
United States, ... An unrelated man in Texas admitted to voting for her in 1872.
